paper_title.ja: 人間教育としての音楽教育
paper_title.en: Music Education to Enrich Human Nature-Study of Hungarian music education starting from children's play songs and examlpes of practicing music education in Japan-

description.ja: The purpose of music education is said to represent expression of emotions and usually emphasis is put on the musical skills. However, I think that the academic research and the understanding arts and culture are the bases of human education, laying the foundation for a rich future for mankind. Since the 3.11 earthquake and the nuclear accident in 2011 in Japan, there has been a great need for human understanding and human bonds again. In this situation, Music Education to enrich human nature has come into prominence in Japan. In this paper I will use two studies to reveal how specifically music education, as human education, can help Japanese music educators: 1. two presentations and the Children's play songs workshops; and 2. contents of the two consultations. Hungarian educator, Márta Pajor's presentations and workshops were presented at the conference of the Japanese Music Education Society in 2012 which were one of the best examples from Hungary where music education as the viewpoint of human education by Zoltán Kodály's philosophy. The others are the contents of the two consultations which were planned and coordinated by Furiya Miyako. Ten panelists took part. They reported about their own practices from primary schools to university classes and school for the disabled. These reports are very beneficial for actual music education now in Japan, and the future direction of music education and method of teaching. The important points of these discussions were: four. These points are no.1. is traditional materials, no.2. is creativity, no.3. is comprehensiveness and dramatization and no.4. is learning and helping each other. We should develop Japanese music education to enrich human nature for the development of mankind.

paper_title.ja: ハンガリーのピアノ教育の発展Ⅱ －アパジ・マーリア著『ピアノの夢ー創造的なピアノ学習』の意義ー
paper_title.en: Development of Hungarian Piano Education Ⅱ-Significance of Hungarian Piano Textbooks Zongoralom Kreativ Zomgoratanilas by Maria Apagyi-

description.ja: Following the great earthquake disaster in eastern Japan on March 11th 2011, the problems concerning the children in Japan became even worse. For them, things are so awful everywhere. Now is the time to think about music education and art education based on the idea that study and art education are essential for developing a human nature rich in the best qualities. The Hungarian music education system was established by Kodály Zoltán (1882-1967), the well-known composer, musicologist and educator. The aim of Hungarian music education is the development of the richest aspects of human nature. In Hungary it is thought that the teaching of music is an integral part of a child's education. The most important mission of the music teacher is to prevent students learning music from turning into mere robots who automatically follow the instructions, or even worse, the commands of their teachers. Based on this concept, music teachers are educating their students to become independent youngsters and, later on, adults with their own ideas and opinions. This will help students to live their lives in a more creative and flexible way, whatever career they will choose. We think we can learn suggestions from Hungarian music education for application in our own country. The recent publication Zongorálom , written by Mária Apagyi (1941- ), three volumes of music textbooks for piano teaching, has so many suggestions for Japanese piano teaching and music education. These books are organized according to interdisciplinarity and are based on the common roots of different fields such as nature, science, poetry, painting and construction, all of which are beautifully related. In this paper we introduce Apagyi's philosophy and her way of teaching piano, and we mention points which are needed, not only in Japanese piano teaching, but also in all kinds of music education. We also introduce opinions about Zongorálom by Mariann Ábrahám(1933- ), the famous Hungarian pianist and the leader of Hungarian piano education. In addition, we introduce researches into the effects of music education in Germany supplementing Apagyi's philosophy and her way of teaching.

paper_title.ja: ハンガリーのピアノ教育の発展--アパジ・マーリア著『ピアノの夢--創造的なピアノ学習』の意義
paper_title.en: Development of Hungarian piano education significance of Hungarian piano textbooks Zongoralom Kreativ Zongoratanulas

description.ja: Hungarian music education system was established by Kodály Zoltán(1882-1967) who was a wellknown composer, musicologist and educator. The aim of Hungarian music education is developing rich human nature. Hungarian music education is organically built up for all grades and phases from child to adult and amateur to professional levels. The philosophy is the same all over the country. Nowadays the problems around the children in Japan are so awful everywhere that we think we would like to learn and get suggestions from Hungarian music education. The recent publication Zongorálom, three volumes of music textbooks for piano teaching, published in 2008 has so many suggestions for Japanese piano teaching and music education. The purpose of the Zongorálom is developing rich human nature and comprehending not just music but also science, history, painting, construction, and all of those are related beautifully. The author is Apagyi Mária. Her major point is the importance of creativity in her educational plan. In this paper we survey Hungarian piano education and introduce Apagyi's philosophy in her piano teaching, and declare the points which are needed in Japanese Music Education.
